oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Braden-Sinai School: photograph of students in front of school
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of students and a teacher posing with school house. Two banks of five, nine over nine light, double hung windows are visible. The building has a side gable roof with a side gable porch roof over the entrance.

The Braden-Sinai School was built circa 1920 with possible support from the Julius Rosenwald Fund. It was used for a Head Start Program and then remained vacant for 18 years. By 1995, it became a residential home and the tall, double-hung windows were replaced with French doors.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Julius Rosenwald Fund -- Buildings; African American schools -- Tennessee; School buildings
